intro: Knautia arvernensis var. angustata, commonly known as narrowleaf knautia, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its slender, angular stems and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is valued in gardens for its ornamental flowers and ability to attract pollinators.
